critique: This executive order pertains to additional compensation for enlisted men of the Coast Guard based on their proficiency in using arms. It establishes a tiered system of compensation based on qualification level. There's no indication of ideological bias, immigration policy, or civil liberties concerns. It does not expand executive power, but rather implements existing legislation. It doesn't directly address federalism or social inclusion. It has a very slight interventionist aspect in specifying compensation, but it's minimal.
